ratings.note: Downgraded by both Moody's (Jun 2025) and Fitch (Jul 2025). Still solid BB-category ratings.

overview.business_description: Ultra low-cost carrier (ULCC) providing passenger air transportation primarily across Europe, North Africa, Middle East, and parts of Asia. One of Europe's largest LCCs by fleet size. Operates Airbus A320/A321neo fleet.
business_positives: LOWEST distress score of 7 - tied for best in portfolio
Plans to repay 2026 bonds without refinancing
overview.fatal_flaw: Rating downgrades in 2025 (Moody's Ba1→Ba2, Fitch →BB). Pratt & Whitney engine issues affecting fleet availability. Airline sector volatility. Fuel cost exposure. Central/Eastern European geopolitical risk (Ukraine proximity).
overview.ownership: Public (LSE: WIZZ). Strong institutional shareholder base including Capital World, Comgest, Artisan, Fidelity, Norway SWF, BlackRock.
overview.recent_news: Plans to repay 1% 2026 bonds without refinancing (Sep 2025). Downgraded to BB by Fitch (Jul 2025). Downgraded to Ba2 negative by Moody's (Jun 2025). Pending Pratt & Whitney agreement on engine issues.

key_ratios.note: Excellent leverage metrics - NET CASH position. Very strong cash generation.

trend_analysis.trend_summary: Remarkable turnaround from COVID losses. EBITDA from -$439m (2022) to +$789m (LTM). Now NET CASH with 1.3x gross leverage. Margin expansion to 12%.

maturity_schedule.note: 2026 bonds to be repaid from cash - no refinancing needed

credit_opinion.summary: Wizz Air has the LOWEST distress score (7) in the XO S44 portfolio despite recent rating downgrades. The company has a NET CASH position of $156m and very low gross leverage of just 1.3x. EBITDA has surged 42% to $789m with margins expanding to 12%. Strong CFFO of $1.16bn provides ample liquidity. The company plans to repay 2026 bonds from cash without refinancing - a sign of financial strength. While rating downgrades (Moody's Ba2 neg, Fitch BB) reflect P&W engine issues and airline volatility, the underlying credit metrics are excellent. Europe's fastest growing ULCC with strong market position.
key_risks: Pratt & Whitney engine issues affecting fleet

distress_indicators.trading_signals: Bond at par (100.00). NET CASH position. LOWEST distress score in portfolio. Plans cash repayment of 2026 bonds. Rating downgrades reflect sector issues not credit weakness.
